intro: Paeonia ostii subsp. lishizhenii, commonly known as the Lishizhen peony, is a rare subspecies native to China. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the芍药属 (Paeonia) family and is known for its ornamental value in traditional Chinese gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, thriving in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
